name: paper-tabs
title: Paper tabs
description: `paper-tabs` is a `core-selector` styled to look like tabs. Tabs make it easy to explore and switch between different views or functional aspects of an app, or to browse categorized data sets. Use `selected` property to get or set the selected tab. Example: TAB 1 TAB 2 TAB 3 See paper-tab for more information about `paper-tab`. A common usage for `paper-tabs` is to use it along with `core-pages` to switch between different views. Tab 1 Tab 2 Tab 3 TAB ONE TAB TWO TAB THREE Styling tabs: To change the sliding bar color: paper-tabs.pink::shadow #selectionBar { background-color: #ff4081; } To change the ink ripple color: paper-tabs.pink paper-tab::shadow #ink { color: #ff4081; }

noink.name: noink
noink.description: If true, ink ripple effect is disabled.
noink.title: Noink

nobar.name: nobar
nobar.description: If true, the bottom bar to indicate the selected tab will not be shown.
nobar.title: Nobar

noslide.name: noslide
noslide.description: If true, the slide effect for the bottom bar is disabled.
noslide.title: Noslide

scrollable.name: scrollable
scrollable.description: If true, tabs are scrollable and the tab width is based on the label width.
scrollable.title: Scrollable

disableDrag.name: disableDrag
disableDrag.description: If true, dragging on the tabs to scroll is disabled.
disableDrag.title: Disable drag

hideScrollButton.name: hideScrollButton
hideScrollButton.description: If true, scroll buttons (left/right arrow) will be hidden for scrollable tabs.
hideScrollButton.title: Hide scroll button

updateBar.name: updateBar
updateBar.description:
Invoke this to update the size and position of the bottom bar.  Usually
you only need to call this if the `paper-tabs` is initially hidden and
later becomes visible.
updateBar.title: Update bar
